de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin
Class PortableMediaCreatorPlugin

java.lang.Object
  de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin.DicomRouterPlugin
      de.iftm.dcm4che.router.plugin.PortableMediaCreatorPlugin

public class PortableMediaCreatorPlugin
extends DicomRouterPlugin

This plugins creates a IHE (Integrating the Healthcare Enterprise) PDI (Portable Data for Imaging) compatible file structure (see http://www.rsna.org/IHE/tf/ihe_tf_index.shtml). The plugin acts as a Portable Media Creator. It supports the properties which start with the key PortableMediaCreatorPlugin. For description of the subkeys (= properties) see the user manual. The following shows an example file structure. Text in [] is example text, which is differnt in other use cases.

[Mustermann^Hans_19570522]/ : Patient Name '_' Date of Birth
INDEX.HTM
README.TXT
DICOM/
[DICOM files in the same sub-directory structur as in IHE_PDI/]
IHE_PDI/
INDEX.HTM : List of studies
COMPARE.HTM : A framneset with two links to INDEX.HTM
[MH570522]/ : First letter of family name followed by first letter of given name followed by date of birth
[043012]/ : Study date (maximum of 8 characters)
[MR1531]/ : Modality, 2 character followed by study time, 4 character
[4711]/ : Study ID (maximum of 8 characters)
INDEX.HTM : List of series
[3]/ : Series Number (maximum of 8 characters)
INDEX.HTM : List of images
[54.jpg] : JPG image.Name is the Instance Number

All INDEX.HTM files are XHTML conform. They are divided into three sections - Title, Info and List - which are separated by a horizontal line. The List section has links to the next INDEX.HTM file. All information concerning an image is organized in tables. There are up to three tables in a file, each with an individaul "id" attribute. Information about the patient are in a table with id="patient", inforamtion about the studies in id="study", inforamtion about the series in id="series" and the images in a table with id="image". All rows in the tables have a unique "id" attribute, derived from the PatientID, StudyInstanceUID, SeriesInstanceUID and InstanceUID for the image. To allow ascending sorting of the table rows each row has a "title" attribute, which contains the sorting key.

This class uses the inner classes HTMLTable, HTMLTableRow and WriteXMLToFileThread.

Constant Field Values

log

org.apache.log4j.Logger log

props

java.util.Properties props
The properties of this plugin

separate_patients

boolean separate_patients
If true, write files in the subdirectory "[$PatientName_$PatientBirthDate]//"

use_subdirectory_dicom

java.lang.String use_subdirectory_dicom
Writes DICOM files in the subdirectory "[$PatientName_$PatientBirthDate/]//".

use_subdirectory_web

java.lang.String use_subdirectory_web
Writes web files in the subdirectory "[$PatientName_$PatientBirthDate/]//".

fileIDComponents

java.lang.String[] fileIDComponents
Array of strings containing the subdirectories extracted from the given Dataset [0]: First letter of family name followed by first letter of given name followed by date of birth, 6 character. Example: MH570522
[1]: Study date, 6 character. Example: 043012
[2]: Modality, 2 character followed by study time, 4 character. Example: MR1531
[3]: Study ID. Example: 4711
[4]: Series number. Example: 3
[5]: Instance number. Example: 54

write_dir_tree

boolean write_dir_tree
If true: Construct the the file ID of the file to save from the following file ID components given by the array in field fileIDComponents.
If false: Construct the the filename of the file to save from directory, name and extension.

image_format

java.lang.String image_format
The ImagIO name of the graphic format to export the Dataset.

listOfStudiesHTMLFile

java.io.File listOfStudiesHTMLFile
HTML file "INDEX.HTM" containing the list of studies for the given Dataset

java.io.File listOfSeriesHTMLFile
HTML file "INDEX.HTM" containing the list of series for the given Dataset

listOfImagesHTMLFile

java.io.File listOfImagesHTMLFile
HTML file "INDEX.HTM" containing the list of images for the given Dataset

The JPG file derived from the given Dataset

protected int fillPatientTable(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                               org.dcm4che.data.Dataset dataset,
                               java.lang.String link)
Inserts patient-information into the table id="patient". Does nothing, if there is already a table row with the same PatientID.

Parameters:
document - the Document containing the DOM represenation of the HTML file.
dataset - the Dataset containing the image data.
link - a string containing the link from the actual HTML file to the HTML file to open, when clicking at the table elemnt in the last column. null, if no link should be used.
Returns:
CONTINUE if succesfull, REQUEST_ABORT_RECEIVER otherwise
